page.title: 03LANDSCAPE, BURSTON AREA
page.content:
The land rises to 625' above sea level giving panoramic views over the Peak District to the North, Welsh Hills to the West and Malvern Hills to the South. Soil is mainly red sandstone. One farm at Smallrise has a geological fault running through the centre, one half being red sandstone, the other marl including five marl pits.
The area is well watered with several small ponds and natural springs. The streams feed into the River Trent. The Trent Valley runs through the SW corner of the area.
There are a number of wooded areas, both coniferous and deciduous, and many hedges. The landscape has changed little over the last 100 years.
